request.name: set_visibility

description.summary: set the visibility of a surface in ivi compositor

request.description: If visibility argument is 0, the surface in the ivi compositor is set to invisible. If visibility argument is not 0, the surface in the ivi compositor is set to visible.

request.name: set_opacity

description.summary: set the opacity of a surface in ivi compositor

request.description: The valid range for opacity is 0.0 (fully transparent) to 1.0 (fully opaque).

request.name: set_source_rectangle

description.summary: set the scanout area of a surface in ivi compositor

request.description: The source rectangle defines the part of the surface content, that is used for compositing the surface. It can be used, if valid content of the surface is smaller than the surface. Effectively it can be used to zoom the content of the surface. If a parameter is less than 0, that value is not changed. x: horizontal start position of scanout area within the surface y: vertical start position of scanout area within the surface width: width of scanout area within the surface height: height of scanout area within the surface

request.name: set_destination_rectangle

description.summary: Set the destination area of a surface within a layer

request.description: The destination rectangle defines the position and size of a surface on a layer. The surface will be scaled to this rectangle for rendering. If a parameter is less than 0, that value is not changed. x: horizontal start position of surface within the layer y: vertical start position of surface within the layer width : width of surface within the layer height: height of surface within the layer

request.name: set_orientation

description.summary: set the orientation of a surface in ivi compositor

request.description: The orientation of a surface in ivi compositor can be rotated in 90 degree steps, as defined in orientation enum.

request.name: screenshot

description.summary: take screenshot of surface

request.description: Store a screenshot of the surface content in the file provided by argument filename.

event.name: visibility

description.summary: the visibility of the surface in ivi compositor has changed

event.description: The new visibility state is provided in argument visibility. If visibility is 0, the surface has become invisible. If visibility is not 0, the surface has become visible.

event.name: opacity

description.summary: the opacity of surface in ivi compositor has changed

event.description: The new opacity state is provided in argument opacity. The valid range for opactiy is 0.0 (fully transparent) to 1.0 (fully opaque).

event.name: source_rectangle

description.summary: the source rectangle of surface in ivi compositor has changed

event.description: The scanout region of the surface content has changed. The new values for source rectangle are provided by x: new horizontal start position of scanout area within the surface y: new vertical start position of scanout area within the surface width: new width of scanout area within the surface height: new height of scanout area within the surface

event.name: destination_rectangle

description.summary: the destination rectangle of surface in ivi compositor has changed

event.description: The new values for source rectangle are provided by x: new horizontal start position of surface within the layer y: new vertical start position of surface within the layer width : new width of surface within the layer height: new height of surface within the layer

event.name: configuration

description.summary: the configuration of surface in ivi compositor has changed

event.description: The client providing content for this surface was requested to resize the buffer provided as surface content. The requested buffer size is provided by arguments width and height.

enum.name: orientation

description.summary: orientation presets in degrees

enum.description: The surfaces in ivi controller can be rotated in 90 degrees steps. This enum defines all valid orientations for surfaces.

event.name: orientation

description.summary: the orientation of surface in ivi compositor has changed

event.description: The new orientation status is provided by argument orientation.

event.name: stats

description.summary: receive updated statistics for surface in ivi compositor

event.description: The information contained in this event is essential for monitoring, debugging, logging and tracing support in IVI systems.

request.name: sync

description.summary: request to synchronize of a surface in ivi compositor

request.description: After this request, compositor sends the properties of the surface. If sync_state argument is 0, compositor sends the properties continously. If sync_state argument is not 0, compositor stops sending the properties continously.

enum.name: type

description.summary: hint for the compositor

enum.description: If a surface is restricted type, visible contents of the surface is strictly controlled by the compositor. Its content is not allowed to be go out of its destination region. If the application resizes its buffers or uses wp_viewporter protocol to scale its contents, the old destination region would causes visible glitches. To avoid these issues, the controller process mark a surface as desktop compatible. Source and destination regions of a desktop compatible surface will be modified accordingly,when application sends a request for resizing or scaling its contents. Therefore, applications contents will be drawn according to application's wishes. On the other hand, source and destination regions will be strictly enforced, when the surface's type is restricted. The default type for a surface is ivi.

request.name: clear

description.summary: remove all surfaces from layer render order

request.description: A layer has no content assigned to itself, it is a container for surfaces. This request removes all surfaces from the layer render order.

description.summary: add a surface to layer render order at nearest z-position

request.description: A layer has no content assigned to itself, it is a container for surfaces. This request adds a surface to the topmost position of the layer render order. The added surface will cover all other surfaces of the layer.

description.summary: remove a surface from layer render order

request.description: A layer has no content assigned to itself, it is a container for surfaces. This request removes one surfaces from the layer render order. Note: the surface is not destroyed, it is just no longer contained by the layer.
